channel.title: Day/night cycle
channel.description:
Uhh, I haven't played for a while, but is the cycle 30 seconds now? How do you guys even play like this, I must of gone downstairs for a drink after it just turning day and it was night again. Obviously 30 seconds is hyperbole but it seems to me that when it finally turns day it's always raining, so even if if you get the enjoy the few minutes that you have as a starter you still have to put up with the rain and increased mob spawns that come with it.
Is this something that we've opted to do, or an update, or a game type or what? Or has it always been like this and I'm just posting from nostalgic infused memories? I would prefer a minecraft world with long days, and long nights to one where you have like 40000000 days/night per real world day.

item.title: Day/night cycle
item.dc:creator: @zuppers zuppers
item.description:
@zuppers wrote:

1 Minecraft day = 20 minutes of gameplay.

Read full topic

item.title: Day/night cycle
item.dc:creator: @kickingjamie kickingjamie
item.description:
@kickingjamie wrote:

I’ve seen on videos that day/night cycles can be messed up by lag, that might have happened but I don’t know.

But the rain is ridiculous.

Read full topic

item.title: Day/night cycle
item.dc:creator: @Phaze_One Fuscate
item.description:
@Phaze_One wrote:

From what I can tell the day/night cycle remains the same at ~10 minutes each. Not sure how that happened to be honest, but I haven’t experienced anything abnormal as of yet.

For the question about rain, its always fucking raining

Read full topic
